reviews.text: Much better than first time when I came here~

This place is so cool!! Itâ€™s so cute; thereâ€™s stuffed pandas everywhere, decorating all the chairs. The couches are really cozy, they even have little pillows. Also really great Chinese music ğŸ˜† I really like that we can order off the iPadâ€¦
always delay for taking out foodï¼Œ never on time
Atmosphere was amazing, Lydia was a great host. 10/10!

Love this place!  Such great food and service!
Had been here several times! All my family like it over hipot! Highly recommended!

Love this hotpot restaurant, food is great, service is great as well. Price is very reasonable. Will definitely come back.

Everything is very good. Food are all fresh. You can DIY your dessert as you like. Customer service is also very nice. They really took good care of us. I will definitely come back.

I had such a great experience at this hotpot restaurant! The atmosphere is cozy and welcoming, perfect for hanging out with friends or family. The food was super fresh, with a wide variety of ingredients and delicious broths. The service was also excellent, the staff were friendly, attentive, and always ready to help.

And I have to mention the desserts,
absolutely amazing! They were the perfect way to end the meal. Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back again soon!

Absolutely love this hot pot restaurant! The ingredients are super fresh, the broth is flavorful, and the dipping sauces are amazing. The staff are friendly and always attentive. The atmosphere is cozy and perfect for gathering with friends or family. Highly recommend if youâ€™re craving authentic and delicious hot pot!

Came here for lunch Sunday, with no reservations, we just walked inâ€”luckily they had tables available!  The restaurant is panda theme!!  Cute decor.

Food was goodâ€”decent amount of meats, seafood and veggies options.  We tried three different broths (Beef Tallow Spicy, Bone Broth & Sour Soup), all relatively good.  Wasnâ€™t too happy with their noodle selection, I prefer thin noodles like vermicelli or glass noodle, which they didnâ€™t have.  They also have a bubble tea menu from the place next door.  Everything here is cost itemizedâ€”you are charged by price for everything, even for using their sauce bar!

If you pay in cash, you get a chance to spin their game for a prizeâ€”we won a cute stuffed llama.  Service was great, all the servers were pretty attentive and came by frequently to refill our broths.

Nanshan Hotpot in Flushing is a must-visit for authentic Chinese hot pot now with their upgraded menus at both their Bayside and Prince Street locations. The Prince Street location is offering 15% OFF until 9/30. The broths are freshly prepared with authentic and premium ingredients are premium including with rare regional specialties. Nanshan also brings trending hot pot items straight from China that you wonâ€™t find elsewhere. On top of the friendly service, Nanshan also offers a free self-serve dessert area, making the experience even sweeter and more enjoyable. Come check them out and enjoy hot pot like locals in China!

Very cute hotpot spot with attentive service and amazing food. The staff was kind enough to assist us with the cooking of the foods and informed us how long things should be cooked for. They were also very timely with cleanup of the table which made for a clean and efficient meal. Highly recommend!
Great service and fresh food. The coconut soup base was definitely unique and worth a try if you like a sweeter flavor.  They have a nice sauce and snack bar as well.

I had a wonderful experience here! The food was absolutely delicious, and the hot pot was outstanding. Everything is panda-themed, which added a fun and charming touch to the whole dining experience â€” I loved seeing pandas everywhere!

The bamboo shoots were a standout for us â€” fresh, flavorful, and perfect in the hot pot. We tried three soup bases: the classic Mala, rich Tomato, and savory Pork Bone. Each one was incredibly tasty and brought out the best in all the ingredients.

Overall, it was a delightful meal in a unique and enjoyable setting. Canâ€™t wait to come back!

Fantastic panda-themed hot pot experience! The broths were incredibly flavorful. The marbled beef was super tender and high-quality. All the ingredients tasted very fresh. Even the side snacks were delicious. The adorable panda decor made the meal even more enjoyable. Highly recommend!
Great vibe and family friendly-the staff are nice and welcoming. Both kids and adults had a great time. No wait - another plus!! Highly recommend the fried pork appetizer and hand made noodles!

I went here for dinner with my family today and it was a blast!! This place has been on my list for a while, and it was so worthwhile. Youâ€™re greeted with a warm handwipe and cute aprons! There was lots of different items to pick on the menu, my favorites were the snack series (especially the pulled fried dough/rice cake). The interior is really cute and clean, loving the panda theme. The staffs were friendly and attentive, and the overall atmosphere was great and lively. The sauce bar also includes some small dishes and even dessert and fruits. At the end, we got cute panda keychains and an adorable panda plush. It does get pricey, but its all worthwhile.

I had a fantastic hot pot experience here! The Angus beef was absolutely delicious and of excellent quality. I particularly loved the tomato soup base â€“ it tasted incredibly fresh and flavorful. The staff were also very welcoming and attentive, providing great service throughout our meal. Highly recommend this place for a wonderful hot pot!
æœ‰å†°ç²‰è¯¶ æ–™å¥½å¤šqwq 10æœˆ15%offï¼æœåŠ¡å‘˜ä¸€ç›´å¿™æ¥å¿™å»çœ‹æ¡Œå¾ˆä»”ç»†

Weâ€™ve been to this hotpot place multiple times and love it every single time! Itâ€™s not all-you-can-eat, so if youâ€™re just a little hungry and want quality over quantity, this is the spot. But if youâ€™ve been saving your appetite all day, you might want to check out an all-you-can-eat option instead.

The seafood and vegetables are always fresh, the soup base is super flavorful, andâ€”most importantlyâ€”the staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming. Huge thanks to everyone for singing Happy Birthday to my daughterâ€”she was so happy, and she absolutely loves her panda doll!

Pro tip: ask them how to win a doll at the end of your mealâ€”itâ€™s such a fun touch!

Delicious and cute hot pot place! Love the panda theme (you can even buy panda plushies here).

Good broth options but slightly limited ingredient options. Itâ€™s sufficient and enjoyable though. Wish the portion sizes were larger too. Some meats have a $15-25 a la carte price tag for ~12 slices. Better bang for your buck elsewhere but the quality here was fine if other nearby places are packed.

Service was good and attentive. Never had a problem with food coming out fast after ordering.

Only confusing thing was their rewards program. There are discount prices if you join the rewards, at least based on the ordering tablet, but the setup is confusing and the staff didnâ€™t socialize it so we were didnâ€™t end up redeeming.

100% authentic and great value Sichuan-style hot pot in Flushing. They have an extensive menu of all the standards and a few items I hadnâ€™t seen at hot pot restaurants in NYC. All very tasty and at reasonable prices! Service was friendly and professional throughout. Also, I love the cute panda theme. Iâ€™ll be back!

Walked by here a lot and finally decided to give it a try. Their space is surprisingly large, didnâ€™t realize thereâ€™s a whole downstairs. Decor is super cute abc panda themed. Tomato broth is def the best, beef tallow broth is a let down (just spicy and not really umami).  They have many ingredients I havenâ€™t seen at other places before, super cute young bamboo shoot presentation. Tender beef with egg yolk was yummy, but would prob save that for last to eat as it clouds the broth with a lot of egg bits. Sauce bar was good and free single serve ice cream cups in the end. Meal is cheaper if you guys voucher credits online. But they have a weird system where the amount of credit you have left has to be larger than the bill total to make you forever topping up or wasting it.
The food here is amazing and the pandas are really cute. Great for friends that just want a fun and affordable meal. Not too busy too on the weekends.

I've been here four times already and it's been solid every single time. Everything is fresh and soup pairings are delicious.

The service was great and staff were able to answer our questions. They gave us recommendations which I'm glad they did. Food was fresh and you get what you pay for. My favorite soup broth was the fruit broth which is more of a tomato flavor. I tried the sour soup (tastes like their fruit soup base with sour and spicy notes) and love that too! The oxtail falls right off the bone and goes well with the spicy soup, as recommended by the staff.

The food, atmosphere, and service here is amazing! The staffs are so attentive and welcoming, and the broths are really delicious as well. I ordered the tomato, bone, and the panda spicy option. Highly recommended!
A great new hotpot space in flushing. We love the food and the space. The ingredients are fresh and the soup base is very tasty. Service was great. Would recommend to my friends.

Amazing time to eat here. The waitresses here are all super nice, theyre very cautious if youre allergic to anything which is a plus for me since im allergic to peanuts and the pricing is quite affordable.
2nd time coming here. They have great deals in October. Still great service and good food quality. Love the hotpot experience here!
The food was very fresh and came out promptly.  The food was plated very nicely and the panda decorations were a plus for the atmosphere.  The servers were very friendly.

I had a great experience here! The service and decor were top notchâ€¦ the waiters were attentive and the decor was adorable!! They definitely won me over with the bone broth as an enoki mushroom enjoyer because the broth included a generous amount of enoki!

The food here was great. They have a very cute panda theme and they have oil that comes in a bear shape.

They have all the normal hot pot foods. I had no issues whatsoever.

There is so much variety of food to choose from, everything was fresh and delicious! The service is very good too! Our waitress was super attentive and helpful!

Came here for a family birthday. The food and ambiance were great. I love the free dessert bar with jellies and pudding.
æœå‹™å¾ˆå¥½ï¼Œé£Ÿç‰©æ–°é®®ï¼Œé‚„å¯ä»¥ç›´æ¥é»éš”å£å¥½å–é£²æ–™åº—æ‚¸å‹•çš„è¶…ç´šæ¯æª¸æª¬èŒ¶ï¼Œå¤§æ¨ï¼

I made a reservation and I was immediately seated upon arrival. The servers were very attentive and kind. The food was good and free panda hair clips were handed out as a gift. I liked how they joined with Tea Pulse next door to sell bubble tea and smoothies which was convenient.

The food is fresh and clean, served in adorable dishware. Portions are small, but you can order as you go. The panda-themed decor so cutesy, and the staff is friendly and welcoming! Bonus: thereâ€™s a bubble tea spot next door, making it super convenient. Definitely coming back!

My family have been here twice this month and had very good experience. The highlight is the panda themed decorations: pot top, dishes, cushions, napkin box, and their signature bamboo dish. So lovely! I l love their rich and flavorful soup base (butter spicy, tomato & fruits). They also have variety of fresh ingredients like sliced beef, fish, shrimp paste, handmade noodleâ€¦The DiY dipping sauce station, good milk tea selection and fast attentive service are added to the great dining experience. Itâ€™s not only perfect for friends gathering but also for families with kids. I didnâ€™t join the membership but will definitely come back again.

Nanshan Hot Pot in Flushing is a fantastic spot for a fun and tasty hot pot experience. The panda-themed decor adds a playful touch, making it a great place to hang out with friends or family.

The menu is loaded with fresh ingredients, so you can mix and match to create your perfect hot pot. Whether youâ€™re into premium meats or fresh veggies, thereâ€™s something for everyone.

The staff is super friendly and always happy to help if youâ€™re not sure what to order. It does get busy during peak times, but the lively atmosphere and amazing food make it worth the wait.

If youâ€™re in Flushing and looking for a great hot pot spot, Nanshan Hot Pot is definitely worth checking out!
Panda Hotpot is very nice. I like their beef and the drinks. Tomato soup base is the best. ğŸ˜‹ The waitress is very nice.
